content.description: This is a shorter problem that works its way out the middle opening of Hobbit Hole.
content.location: Start on the far underside edge of the main boulder above the start of Shelob’s Lair and My Prrrecious with your feet far out on the opposite rock.  Work your way a few moves horizontally to the large protruding rectangular block.  Squeeze and pull your way up and over to the topout.  The right rock toward the end of the problem is on, but it will mostly only be used for pressing up against it to get up and over the topout.

content.description: This is a fun problem if you can get it to go.  As for the beta, it’s kind of a free for all.  You primarily climb on one boulder with the exception for the starting feet and hand or foot jams. Start in the middle of the cave working your way along the roof toward the side facing Pyramid Boulder finagling with what beta works for you (I used left hand and foot jams and right toe hooks while moving my right through the holds).  Once you reach the crystal hold at the base, either throw a right foot cam out or keep tracking up making your way up over the lip along the arete and right sidepull into the topout.
content.location: This problem starts in the middle of the cave (back facing Pyramid) with right hand on a small crimp on the face and left in a jam up in the crevasse with feet pressed up against the rock across you.  Work your way through the cave to the lip, up and over using the left arete into the topout.  It’s up to you what pads you want, but the smaller the better (it’s a short and soft landing).  You will probably skim the pads and a couple of rocks around you, but as long as any of your parts aren’t crashing into them I wouldn’t consider it a dab it’s not worth the frustration (if you’re not about that don’t climb it). To be honest I really have no idea what grade this goes at.  My guess is V5-7, but that will also greatly vary based on the individuals stature and strengths, so I will let you guys throw up what grade you think it is, because mine is just a shot in the dark.

content.description: A fun traversing problem starting from the middle of the cave out the opposite end of Shelob’s Lair.  Once again it is a pretty tight problem and the grade will vary based on height and stature.  You may scrape dab a little at the end of the problem but don’t worry about it as long as you aren’t thudding on the ground (they are more distractions than assistance).
content.location: Start on the far ledge of the middle opening in the cave where the left hand start for Shelob’s Lair is.  Traverse your way as far along the ledge as you can and make a big move through a blank section to the exit portion of the problem.  From there finagle you’re way up and through the topout using whatever beta works for you.  For this problem any rock other than the ground is on.

content.description: A short, sharp, and powerful problem going up the small face facing the Pyramid Boulder. This is the outside start to Shelob’s Lair.
content.location: Start on the crystal at the bottom of the face with feet under the cave.  Work your way up the sharp left arete and a right sidepull to the topout.   (Beta Assistance: you can use a right foot jam on this problem).

content.description: A very interesting and definitely unique area consisting of a few small boulders creating a tight cave like atmosphere.  It will be crammed when climbing down there, but the problems are worth while once you get your own beta to work.  Beta described for these problems is for a 5’7” individual, however there are definitely possibilities for broken beta on any of these problems based on your stature and strengths.
